name: BEST WESTERN Grand Hotel Adriatico

reviews.text: Don't have any complaints. Good location near train station and walking distance to all major tourist sites. Rooms were immaculate and newly renovated. Bathroom had heated towel bar. Front desk was helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: definitely recommend

likes.liked: — cleanliness, courteous staff, quality of accomodation

reviews.text: Stay in hotel Adriatico was part of Gate1 tour that happened in Apr 2008. It was a very wise choice on their part - 20 mintes of leisure walk walk to all main sights. A lot of Italians were staying in a hotel as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are not comforable in immigrant block, you might feel unasfe walking at night. But really there is no problem - its a city and you have to live its life. For italians it wasn't a problem - there are a lot of great restaurants, wine bars near the hotel filled by locals. We had one of the best meals just around the corner from our hotel (recommended by british guidebook Lets go Italy)
reviews.title: Close to Turist Attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Train and bus station is 7 min walk from a hotel - very convinient for trips outside of Florence.
reviews.title: Reasonable but nothing special.

likes.liked: — Staff were very pleasant and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the brand you'll find some amenities Americans are used to, it has more modern classic than traditional tuscan design. Hotel is eco friendly with light saving option. Breakfast was european style with cold meat cuts, bread, fresh fruit, some cereal, omlet (very runny) and deserts.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: Great hotel right in the middle of Florence. Easy walking to lots of attractions plus the major city squares. Quite elegant. Excellent breakfast. Good concierge service (tour tickets etc). This is also a Best Western (which in Europe is different from many US BW's). Breakfast provided and excellent. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Pleased to see some good reviews have come up since I last looked. Have recently returned from a week at the Adriatico and found it very good. Staff helpful and mostly friendly (it's amazing how much good will you get from trying the most basic Italian - even "buon giorno" is a start - though everyone we encountered had at least some English). Room comfortable. Breakfast good. Don't expect a lot of local colour in the hotel itself - but the rest of Florence is full of it. Location near-perfect - did everything on foot and didn't even need a taxi from the station. Area perfectly OK, though as Londoners we are used to what cities are like, so are not going to be put off by the rather dimly-lit streets or the odd bar with customers spilling on to the pavement.
reviews.title: Definitely recommended

likes.disliked: — Not much sense of locality - once inside, could have been anywhere

reviews.text: Hotel restaurant welcoming and pretty good, if offering a rather limited menu. Can recommend two nearby trattorie - Cento Poveri in Via Palazzuolo and Armando in Borgognissanti. Neither particularly cheap (particularly Armando which specialises in Tuscan dishes) but not ruinous and both friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Perfect base for first visit to Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from four nights at the Adriatico. Contrary to some reviews here, the location couldn’t be much better: it is a short walk from the train station and a quiet and convenient base from which to explore the wonder that is Florence. Five minutes walk away is the church of Santa Maria Novella; another five minutes walk to the Baptistery; ten minutes from there to Santa Croce. In other words: you arrive at what Ruskin considered some of the central expressions of European Christianity within very easy walking. The bus station is also close, great for a day out in Sienna.
reviews.title: Good Hotel poor Location

likes.liked: — Great rooms very clean and big, plasma TV
